text: What is the primary purpose of using a chelating agent in complexometric titration?
options: c. Forming stable complexes with metal ions
d. Adjusting the pH of the water sample

text: Which ion contributes to permanent hardness in water?
Why is it necessary to add a buffer solution in the complexometric titration of water hardness?
What indicator is commonly used in complexometric titrations for endpoint detection?
Which type of hardness can be removed by boiling water?
options: c. Both temporary and permanent hardness
d. Neither temporary nor permanent hardness

text: What is the unit of measurement for water hardness?
What information is crucial for continuous monitoring during the experiment?
When is resin regeneration necessary in the experiment?
options: c. When the resin reaches its capacity

text: What is the purpose of passing the water sample through the ion exchange column in the experiment?
options: b. To collect a representative water sample
c. To calibrate the ion exchange resin

text: What role does the metal ion play in the formation of a complex during complexometric titration?
options: c. Binds with the chelating agent
